analyzed_topics.content: FIND THE PERFECT GIFT FOR YOU & YOURS: TAKE THE GIFT FINDER üéÅ Products Formulated with Dimethicone Need more knowledge about Dimethicone? Dimethicone is the oldest and most prevalent silicone-based ingredient in skincare , haircare, and cosmetics, and it‚Äôs frequently found in moisturizers , as well as in other skin-softening and smoothing emollients . 1,2 It has a silky texture that enables it to glide luxuriously over skin. Because of its consistency and matte finish, it can also be helpful for concealing redness and blemishes , as well as helping disguise enlarged pores and fine lines . 2 Other dimethicone uses include helping to maintain moisture in your skin and keeping environmental irritants out by supporting your skin‚Äôs protective barrier . 1 While there are varying opinions on the use of dimethicone in skincare, experts agree that silicones are safe and do not pose a risk to humans when used in skincare products. In fact, dimethicone is frequently used to both help manage and prevent skin issues, like dry skin and minor skin irritations, with minimal to no risk of side effects. 2,3 The restorative qualities of dimethicone make it a highly sought-after skincare ingredient in moisturizers and creams. Below, discover which CeraVe products feature this beneficial ingredient. Frequently Asked Questions If you have questions about what dimethicone is, wonder what some dimethicone for skin benefits are, or feel like getting to the bottom of other dimethicone myths, check out our frequently asked questions about the ingredient below. Dimethicone is a fluid type of silicone with a highly flexible synthetic makeup, and it‚Äôs the oldest and most used silicone in skincare, haircare, and cosmetic products. 1,2 Dimethicone cream, dimethicone ointment, and dimethicone lotions are widespread and can be especially helpful for those with oily , acne-prone skin , or sensitive skin . This is because dimethicone is frequently in oil-free skincare and can help your skin retain moisture without leaving a greasy feel or clogging your pores. It‚Äôs also hypoallergenic, has minimal to no risk of side effects, and is used to help manage or prevent certain skin conditions. 3,4 Based on its protective, hydrating, and soothing properties, it‚Äôs no surprise why products with dimethicone are so popular. 5 Dimethicone has both emollient and occlusive properties, meaning it softens and smooths skin, helps lock in hydration, and improves skin barrier function. 4,6 Interestingly, although dimethicone won‚Äôt dissolve in water, water vapor can penetrate it, so it does a great job of retaining moisture in the skin without suffocating it. 1 It also has a silky matte texture, which helps hide redness, blemishes, enlarged pores, and fine lines, and a consistency that effortlessly glides across skin. 2 Other benefits of dimethicone in skincare are that it‚Äôs hypoallergenic, fragrance-free, and won‚Äôt clog your pores. It‚Äôs present in some body washes, too, since it helps improve creaminess, stability, and the overall quality of foamed up lather. 1 In haircare, dimethicone is often found in two-in-one shampoo/conditioners, because it can protect the hair shaft during washing and help boost volume. What dimethicone is used for in skincare centers around its ability to help with moisturization, which is tied to its skin-softening and barrier-supporting properties. It also helps visibly smooth the appearance of skin, such as with enlarged pores and fine lines, and camouflages redness and blemishes. 1,2 Dimethicone is a type of silicone called a ‚Äúlinear polysiloxane‚Äù or ‚Äúpolydimethylsiloxane.‚Äù It‚Äôs a very strong and resilient ingredient yet it‚Äôs also flexible. Some other features of silicones, like dimethicone, are that they‚Äôre noncarcinogenic, nontoxic, hypoallergenic, odorless, and colorless. There are myriad products that contain dimethicone in skincare. Some of the most prevalent products are moisturizers, as well as dimethicone cream and dimethicone ointment. This is because the ingredient helps keep skin hydrated, soothed, and protected against damage. 1,5 But dimethicone isn‚Äôt just limited to skincare. It also has a place in many cosmetic and haircare formulations, especially as a protectant in two-in-one shampoo/conditioners. 1,2 At CeraVe, you can find dimethicone in several of our therapeutic products, like CeraVe Therapeutic Hand Cream . Using dimethicone, niacinamide , hyaluronic acid , and three essential ceramides as its star ingredients, this formula helps repair dry, chapped, chafed, or cracked hands. It also helps support your skin‚Äôs protective barrier while quenching its thirst, leaving it feeling soft and looking healthier. If itchy skin is a concern of yours, try CeraVe Hydrocortisone Anti-Itch Cream , which contains its namesake hydrocortisone (1%) and dimethicone, along with ceramides, niacinamide, and hyaluronic acid. Rough and bumpy skin , sometimes known as ‚Äúchicken skin,‚Äù can occur at any age or stage of life. Rough skin and/or bumpy skin can be caused by dryness, a buildup of dead skin cells, or certain skin conditions such as eczema , 1 psoriasis , 2 diabetes , 3 or keratosis pilaris 4 ; the latter of which is caused when keratin blocks hair follicles. CeraVe‚Äôs head-to-toe products for rough and bumpy skin contain salicylic acid and lactic acid to help improve skin‚Äôs natural turnover and visibly smooth texture. Each face and body cleanser, body wash, lotion, and cream is formulated with three essential ceramides to restore and maintain your skin barrier, which helps lock in moisture and keep irritants out. FAQ Both salicylic acid and lactic acid are gentle exfoliants that help treat rough patches of skin, albeit in slightly different ways. Salicylic acid is a beta-hydroxy acid that is derived from the bark of certain plants. It works by loosening the ‚Äúglue‚Äù that holds the skin cells on the top layer together. By helping your skin shed dead skin cells faster, newer, healthier-looking skin is revealed, leaving it feeling softer and smoother. Lactic acid is an alpha-hydroxy acid that‚Äôs a natural byproduct of plant and dairy fermentation. It is known to help loosen the bonds that hold dead skin cells together to leave your skin softer, smoother, and with enhanced overall texture. 5 But lactic acid has another trick up its sleeve. Since it‚Äôs part of the skin‚Äôs natural moisturizing factor, or NMF, it helps keep your skin hydrated as well. 6 T. Ruzicka, B. Przybilla, J. analyzed_topics.title: Solutions for Dry Skin | CeraVe
analyzed_topics.content: FIND THE PERFECT GIFT FOR YOU & YOURS: TAKE THE GIFT FINDER üéÅ Products for Dry Skin Want to learn more about dry skin (including what to look for in skincare products for dry skin)? Dry skin (formally known as xeroderma) is a common skin concern that can occur seasonally or year-round. It‚Äôs caused when your skin‚Äôs protective barrier is weakened, resulting in a loss of moisture in the skin‚Äôs outermost layer. Whether it's on your face , hands, feet , or anywhere else on your body, dry skin can feel tight, itchy , and uncomfortable. It may also appear visibly rough , scaly , or flaky . CeraVe‚Äôs expansive range of face and body products helps relieve the feelings of discomfort caused by dry skin. Our skincare products for dry skin are formulated with gentle, hydrating, and soothing ingredients , plus three essential ceramides to lock in moisture and help maintain your skin‚Äôs protective barrier. From cleansers to moisturizers , ointments , and more, CeraVe‚Äôs best products for dry skin offer fragrance-free , dermatologist-developed options to help reduce dryness and support hydrated, soft, healthy-looking skin. Find Our Best Products for Dry Skin Explore our range of skincare products for dry skin to find the right option for your skin‚Äôs unique needs‚Äînow and throughout the year. Frequently Asked Questions Dry skin, which affects most of us at some point in our lives, can have many possible causes. It can be influenced by both internal and external factors, including low humidity, cold weather , certain skin conditions or illnesses, and taking excessively long, hot showers. 1 A board-certified dermatologist can help identify the root cause(s) of your dry skin, as well as recommend the best products for dry skin to help you restore the look of hydrated, smooth, more comfortable-feeling skin. To learn more about dry skin causes, head to our guide on dry vs. dehydrated skin . Everyone‚Äôs skin is unique. This means that‚Äîdepending on factors like your age , environment, and health status‚Äîsigns of dry skin can vary from person to person. According to the Mayo Clinic , when skin loses too much moisture, you may experience a feeling of tightness, as well as rough texture, itchiness, flaking, and more visible fine lines. These signs of dry skin may worsen with age (especially over 40), as well as during the harsh, dry winter months 1 . That‚Äôs why it‚Äôs so important to listen to your skin and seek the help of a dermatologist when needed. To help tackle dry skin, you‚Äôll need a targeted skincare routine that helps preserve and enhance skin moisture levels. We recommend using a gentle, yet effective cleanser for dry skin twice daily to remove excess oil and dirt, without leaving your skin feeling stripped. Applying moisturizer regularly‚Äîespecially after bathing when your skin is still slightly damp‚Äîis another important step to help hydrate and soothe dry skin. It may also be helpful to carry travel-friendly skincare products for dry skin, like moisturizing hand cream or ointment, to help relieve dryness on-the-go. Proper sun protective measures should also be a core part of your daily dry skin regimen since damage from the sun‚Äôs harmful rays may worsen dryness 1 . For further guidance on how to help relieve dry skin, consult with your physician or dermatologist. Dry skin that is painful, cracks, bleeds, or interferes with your quality of life should always be assessed by a medical professional and may be a sign of an underlying illness 1 . When looking for the best products for dry skin, check the label for beneficial ingredients (like hyaluronic acid , glycerin, and niacinamide ) and seals of approval from reputable organizations (like the National Eczema Association). The American Academy of Dermatology AAD , for instance, recommends avoiding products that contain alcohol, fragrance, or harsh chemical exfoliants, as these may be irritating to dry skin or strip away natural oils. 2 This is one of many reasons all CeraVe products for dry skin are fragrance-free and developed with dermatologists . Formulated with three essential ceramides , they also help to lock in moisture and help maintain your skin‚Äôs protective barrier. Ceramides (pronounced ‚Äúsair-uh-mydes‚Äù) are essential natural fatty components of human and animal skin, making up around 50% of its outer layer. They‚Äôre essential in helping to replenish and maintain your natural protective skin barrier, which helps keep moisture in and harmful elements out. 3 When there‚Äôs a lack of humidity in the air, the levels of ceramides in your skin become depleted, leading to dry skin and other issues. Plus, as we age, our natural production of ceramides slows down. Both of these factors can contribute to dry skin either seasonally or year-round. 3 This is why ceramides are such an effective ingredient in skincare products for dry skin, as well as for healthy-looking skin in general. topics.content: FIND THE PERFECT GIFT FOR YOU & YOURS: TAKE THE GIFT FINDER üéÅ Products for Dry Skin Want to learn more about dry skin (including what to look for in skincare products for dry skin)? Dry skin (formally known as xeroderma) is a common skin concern that can occur seasonally or year-round. It‚Äôs caused when your skin‚Äôs protective barrier is weakened, resulting in a loss of moisture in the skin‚Äôs outermost layer. Whether it's on your face , hands, feet , or anywhere else on your body, dry skin can feel tight, itchy , and uncomfortable. It may also appear visibly rough , scaly , or flaky . CeraVe‚Äôs expansive range of face and body products helps relieve the feelings of discomfort caused by dry skin. Our skincare products for dry skin are formulated with gentle, hydrating, and soothing ingredients , plus three essential ceramides to lock in moisture and help maintain your skin‚Äôs protective barrier. From cleansers to moisturizers , ointments , and more, CeraVe‚Äôs best products for dry skin offer fragrance-free , dermatologist-developed options to help reduce dryness and support hydrated, soft, healthy-looking skin. Find Our Best Products for Dry Skin Explore our range of skincare products for dry skin to find the right option for your skin‚Äôs unique needs‚Äînow and throughout the year. Frequently Asked Questions Dry skin, which affects most of us at some point in our lives, can have many possible causes. It can be influenced by both internal and external factors, including low humidity, cold weather , certain skin conditions or illnesses, and taking excessively long, hot showers. 1 A board-certified dermatologist can help identify the root cause(s) of your dry skin, as well as recommend the best products for dry skin to help you restore the look of hydrated, smooth, more comfortable-feeling skin. To learn more about dry skin causes, head to our guide on dry vs. dehydrated skin . Everyone‚Äôs skin is unique. This means that‚Äîdepending on factors like your age , environment, and health status‚Äîsigns of dry skin can vary from person to person. According to the Mayo Clinic , when skin loses too much moisture, you may experience a feeling of tightness, as well as rough texture, itchiness, flaking, and more visible fine lines. These signs of dry skin may worsen with age (especially over 40), as well as during the harsh, dry winter months 1 . That‚Äôs why it‚Äôs so important to listen to your skin and seek the help of a dermatologist when needed. To help tackle dry skin, you‚Äôll need a targeted skincare routine that helps preserve and enhance skin moisture levels. We recommend using a gentle, yet effective cleanser for dry skin twice daily to remove excess oil and dirt, without leaving your skin feeling stripped. Applying moisturizer regularly‚Äîespecially after bathing when your skin is still slightly damp‚Äîis another important step to help hydrate and soothe dry skin. It may also be helpful to carry travel-friendly skincare products for dry skin, like moisturizing hand cream or ointment, to help relieve dryness on-the-go. Proper sun protective measures should also be a core part of your daily dry skin regimen since damage from the sun‚Äôs harmful rays may worsen dryness 1 . For further guidance on how to help relieve dry skin, consult with your physician or dermatologist. Dry skin that is painful, cracks, bleeds, or interferes with your quality of life should always be assessed by a medical professional and may be a sign of an underlying illness 1 . When looking for the best products for dry skin, check the label for beneficial ingredients (like hyaluronic acid , glycerin, and niacinamide ) and seals of approval from reputable organizations (like the National Eczema Association). The American Academy of Dermatology AAD , for instance, recommends avoiding products that contain alcohol, fragrance, or harsh chemical exfoliants, as these may be irritating to dry skin or strip away natural oils. 2 This is one of many reasons all CeraVe products for dry skin are fragrance-free and developed with dermatologists . Formulated with three essential ceramides , they also help to lock in moisture and help maintain your skin‚Äôs protective barrier. Ceramides (pronounced ‚Äúsair-uh-mydes‚Äù) are essential natural fatty components of human and animal skin, making up around 50% of its outer layer. They‚Äôre essential in helping to replenish and maintain your natural protective skin barrier, which helps keep moisture in and harmful elements out. 3 When there‚Äôs a lack of humidity in the air, the levels of ceramides in your skin become depleted, leading to dry skin and other issues. Plus, as we age, our natural production of ceramides slows down. Both of these factors can contribute to dry skin either seasonally or year-round. 3 This is why ceramides are such an effective ingredient in skincare products for dry skin, as well as for healthy-looking skin in general. In addition to skin-essential ceramides, the American Academy of Dermatology (AAD) recommends looking f

Body moisturizers, like body lotions and body creams, are a key part of any successful skincare routine . Using the right body moisturizer formulated for your skin type can help hydrate, seal in moisture, and leave your skin looking more supple, smoother, and healthier. When used consistently as part of a daily body care routine , body moisturizers can also help maintain your skin barrier and manage skin concerns such as dryness , rough skin texture, and itchy skin . CeraVe‚Äôs fragrance-free body moisturizers are developed with dermatologists to help soothe and support healthy-looking skin. Formulated with three essential ceramides , these body lotions, body creams, ointment, and oil help lock in moisture and maintain your skin‚Äôs protective barrier. You‚Äôll also find targeted treatments designed to smooth rough and bumpy skin and soothe itching and other symptoms from chronic conditions such as eczema and psoriasis . Find the Best Body Moisturizer for Your Skin Explore our range of body moisturizers to find the right option for your skin‚Äôs unique needs. Frequently Asked Questions According to the American Academy of Dermatology, all skin types‚Äîeven oily ones‚Äîcan benefit from supplemental hydration 1 . That‚Äôs where body moisturizer comes in: It helps hydrate and soothe skin, whether it‚Äôs on your hands, knees, feet , or elsewhere. Body moisturizer, such as body lotion and body cream, is usually applied as the final step in your daily body care routine to help keep your skin feeling smoother, softer, and more comfortable. CeraVe Daily Moisturizing Lotion , for example, can be used as often as needed to provide 48-hour hydration and help restore your skin‚Äôs protective barrier. This lightweight, oil-free body lotion is also formulated with three essential ceramides and MVE Delivery Technology, which encapsulates hydrating ingredients to ensure efficient delivery and slow release over time. Body lotions and body creams provide similar moisturizing benefits, however they‚Äôre formulated into different textures. Lotions, for example, tend to contain more water in their formulations than creams, giving them a more lightweight feeling, which may be more ideal for those with oily or normal skin. On the other hand, body creams (such as CeraVe Moisturizing Cream ) have a richer formulas with more emollient ingredients than body lotions. Their nourishing texture can be helpful for anyone with normal to dry skin or for seasonal dryness that can occur during winter months. Body creams can also be useful for mature skin, which tends to lose its ability to retain moisture with age. topics.content: FIND THE PERFECT GIFT FOR YOU & YOURS: TAKE THE GIFT FINDER üéÅ Rough & Bumpy Skin Relief Products Take your skincare further Build your own regimen or let us help you with our Skincare Solution Finder Quiz! Step 1 Facial Cleansers Step 2 Treatment Step 3 Facial Moisturizers Step 4 Sunscreen Skincare Solution Finder PERSONALIZED SKINCARE DEVELOPED WITH DERMATOLOGISTS READY AT YOUR FINGER TIPS TAKE THE QUIZ Need more knowledge about rough and bumpy skin? Rough and bumpy skin , sometimes known as ‚Äúchicken skin,‚Äù can occur at any age or stage of life. Rough skin and/or bumpy skin can be caused by dryness, a buildup of dead skin cells, or certain skin conditions such as eczema , 1 psoriasis , 2 diabetes , 3 or keratosis pilaris 4 ; the latter of which is caused when keratin blocks hair follicles. CeraVe‚Äôs head-to-toe products for rough and bumpy skin contain salicylic acid and lactic acid to help improve skin‚Äôs natural turnover and visibly smooth texture. Each face and body cleanser, body wash, lotion, and cream is formulated with three essential ceramides to restore and maintain your skin barrier, which helps lock in moisture and keep irritants out. FAQ Both salicylic acid and lactic acid are gentle exfoliants that help treat rough patches of skin, albeit in slightly different ways. Salicylic acid is a beta-hydroxy acid that is derived from the bark of certain plants. It works by loosening the ‚Äúglue‚Äù that holds the skin cells on the top layer together. By helping your skin shed dead skin cells faster, newer, healthier-looking skin is revealed, leaving it feeling softer and smoother. Lactic acid is an alpha-hydroxy acid that‚Äôs a natural byproduct of plant and dairy fermentation. It is known to help loosen the bonds that hold dead skin cells together to leave your skin softer, smoother, and with enhanced overall texture. 5 But lactic acid has another trick up its sleeve. Since it‚Äôs part of the skin‚Äôs natural moisturizing factor, or NMF, it helps keep your skin hydrated as well. 6 T. Ruzicka, B. Przybilla, J. Ring (2006) Handbook of Atopic Eczema; 2nd edition; Springer Michelle A. Lowes, Anne M. Bowcock, James G. topics.title: Dimethicone in Skincare | Hydrating Skincare Ingredient | CeraVe
topics.content: FIND THE PERFECT GIFT FOR YOU & YOURS: TAKE THE GIFT FINDER üéÅ Products Formulated with Dimethicone Need more knowledge about Dimethicone? Dimethicone is the oldest and most prevalent silicone-based ingredient in skincare , haircare, and cosmetics, and it‚Äôs frequently found in moisturizers , as well as in other skin-softening and smoothing emollients . 1,2 It has a silky texture that enables it to glide luxuriously over skin. Because of its consistency and matte finish, it can also be helpful for concealing redness and blemishes , as well as helping disguise enlarged pores and fine lines . 2 Other dimethicone uses include helping to maintain moisture in your skin and keeping environmental irritants out by supporting your skin‚Äôs protective barrier . 1 While there are varying opinions on the use of dimethicone in skincare, experts agree that silicones are safe and do not pose a risk to humans when used in skincare products. In fact, dimethicone is frequently used to both help manage and prevent skin issues, like dry skin and minor skin irritations, with minimal to no risk of side effects. 2,3 The restorative qualities of dimethicone make it a highly sought-after skincare ingredient in moisturizers and creams. Below, discover which CeraVe products feature this beneficial ingredient. Frequently Asked Questions If you have questions about what dimethicone is, wonder what some dimethicone for skin benefits are, or feel like getting to the bottom of other dimethicone myths, check out our frequently asked questions about the ingredient below. Dimethicone is a fluid type of silicone with a highly flexible synthetic makeup, and it‚Äôs the oldest and most used silicone in skincare, haircare, and cosmetic products. 1,2 Dimethicone cream, dimethicone ointment, and dimethicone lotions are widespread and can be especially helpful for those with oily , acne-prone skin , or sensitive skin . This is because dimethicone is frequently in oil-free skincare and can help your skin retain moisture without leaving a greasy feel or clogging your pores. It‚Äôs also hypoallergenic, has minimal to no risk of side effects, and is used to help manage or prevent certain skin conditions. 3,4 Based on its protective, hydrating, and soothing properties, it‚Äôs no surprise why products with dimethicone are so popular. 5 Dimethicone has both emollient and occlusive properties, meaning it softens and smooths skin, helps lock in hydration, and improves skin barrier function. 4,6 Interestingly, although dimethicone won‚Äôt dissolve in water, water vapor can penetrate it, so it does a great job of retaining moisture in the skin without suffocating it. 1 It also has a silky matte texture, which helps hide redness, blemishes, enlarged pores, and fine lines, and a consistency that effortlessly glides across skin. 2 Other benefits of dimethicone in skincare are that it‚Äôs hypoallergenic, fragrance-free, and won‚Äôt clog your pores. It‚Äôs present in some body washes, too, since it helps improve creaminess, stability, and the overall quality of foamed up lather. 1 In haircare, dimethicone is often found in two-in-one shampoo/conditioners, because it can protect the hair shaft during washing and help boost volume. What dimethicone is used for in skincare centers around its ability to help with moisturization, which is tied to its skin-softening and barrier-supporting properties. It also helps visibly smooth the appearance of skin, such as with enlarged pores and fine lines, and camouflages redness and blemishes. 1,2 Dimethicone is a type of silicone called a ‚Äúlinear polysiloxane‚Äù or ‚Äúpolydimethylsiloxane.‚Äù It‚Äôs a very strong and resilient ingredient yet it‚Äôs also flexible. Some other features of silicones, like dimethicone, are that they‚Äôre noncarcinogenic, nontoxic, hypoallergenic, odorless, and colorless. There are myriad products that contain dimethicone in skincare. Some of the most prevalent products are moisturizers, as well as dimethicone cream and dimethicone ointment. This is because the ingredient helps keep skin hydrated, soothed, and protected against damage. 1,5 But dimethicone isn‚Äôt just limited to skincare. It also has a place in many cosmetic and haircare formulations, especially as a protectant in two-in-one shampoo/conditioners. 1,2 At CeraVe, you can find dimethicone in several of our therapeutic products, like CeraVe Therapeutic Hand Cream . Because of its consistency and matte finish, it can also be helpful for concealing redness and blemishes , as well as helping disguise enlarged pores and fine lines . 2 Other dimethicone uses include helping to maintain moisture in your skin and keeping environmental irritants out by supporting your skin‚Äôs protective barrier . 1 While there are varying opinions on the use of dimethicone in skincare, experts agree that silicones are safe and do not pose a risk to humans when used in skincare products. In fact, dimethicone is frequently used to both help manage and prevent skin issues, like dry skin and minor skin irritations, with minimal to no risk of side effects. 2,3 The restorative qualities of dimethicone make it a highly sought-after skincare ingredient in moisturizers and creams. This is because dimethicone is frequently in oil-free skincare and can help your skin retain moisture without leaving a greasy feel or clogging your pores. It‚Äôs also hypoallergenic, has minimal to no risk of side effects, and is used to help manage or prevent certain skin conditions. 3,4 Based on its protective, hydrating, and soothing properties, it‚Äôs no surprise why products with dimethicone are so popular. 5 Dimethicone has both emollient and occlusive properties, meaning it softens and smooths skin, helps lock in hydration, and improves skin barrier function. 4,6 Interestingly, although dimethicone won‚Äôt dissolve in water, water vapor can penetrate it, so it does a great job of retaining moisture in the skin without suffocating it. 1 It also has a silky matte texture, which helps hide redness, blemishes, enlarged pores, and fine lines, and a consistency that effortlessly glides across skin. 2 Other benefits of dimethicone in skincare are that it‚Äôs hypoallergenic, fragrance-free, and won‚Äôt clog your pores. Rough and bumpy skin , sometimes known as ‚Äúchicken skin,‚Äù can occur at any age or stage of life. Rough skin and/or bumpy skin can be caused by dryness, a buildup of dead skin cells, or certain skin conditions such as eczema , 1 psoriasis , 2 diabetes , 3 or keratosis pilaris 4 ; the latter of which is caused when keratin blocks hair follicles. CeraVe‚Äôs head-to-toe products for rough and bumpy skin contain salicylic acid and lactic acid to help improve skin‚Äôs natural turnover and visibly smooth texture. Each face and body cleanser, body wash, lotion, and cream is formulated with three essential ceramides to restore and maintain your skin barrier, which helps lock in moisture and keep irritants out. FAQ Both salicylic acid and lactic acid are gentle exfoliants that help treat rough patches of skin, albeit in slightly different ways. Salicylic acid is a beta-hydroxy acid that is derived from the bark of certain plants. It works by loosening the ‚Äúglue‚Äù that holds the skin cells on the top layer together. By helping your skin shed dead skin cells faster, newer, healthier-looking skin is revealed, leaving it feeling softer and smoother. Lactic acid is an alpha-hydroxy acid that‚Äôs a natural byproduct of plant and dairy fermentation. It is known to help loosen the bonds that hold dead skin cells together to leave your skin softer, smoother, and with enhanced overall texture. 5 But lactic acid has another trick up its sleeve. Since it‚Äôs part of the skin‚Äôs natural moisturizing factor, or NMF, it helps keep your skin hydrated as well. 6 T. Ruzicka, B. Przybilla, J. top_priority_topics.title: Solutions for Dry Skin | CeraVe
top_priority_topics.content: FIND THE PERFECT GIFT FOR YOU & YOURS: TAKE THE GIFT FINDER üéÅ Products for Dry Skin Want to learn more about dry skin (including what to look for in skincare products for dry skin)? Dry skin (formally known as xeroderma) is a common skin concern that can occur seasonally or year-round. It‚Äôs caused when your skin‚Äôs protective barrier is weakened, resulting in a loss of moisture in the skin‚Äôs outermost layer. Whether it's on your face , hands, feet , or anywhere else on your body, dry skin can feel tight, itchy , and uncomfortable. It may also appear visibly rough , scaly , or flaky . CeraVe‚Äôs expansive range of face and body products helps relieve the feelings of discomfort caused by dry skin. Our skincare products for dry skin are formulated with gentle, hydrating, and soothing ingredients , plus three essential ceramides to lock in moisture and help maintain your skin‚Äôs protective barrier. From cleansers to moisturizers , ointments , and more, CeraVe‚Äôs best products for dry skin offer fragrance-free , dermatologist-developed options to help reduce dryness and support hydrated, soft, healthy-looking skin. Find Our Best Products for Dry Skin Explore our range of skincare products for dry skin to find the right option for your skin‚Äôs unique needs‚Äînow and throughout the year. Frequently Asked Questions Dry skin, which affects most of us at some point in our lives, can have many possible causes. It can be influenced by both internal and external factors, including low humidity, cold weather , certain skin conditions or illnesses, and taking excessively long, hot showers. 1 A board-certified dermatologist can help identify the root cause(s) of your dry skin, as well as recommend the best products for dry skin to help you restore the look of hydrated, smooth, more comfortable-feeling skin. To learn more about dry skin causes, head to our guide on dry vs. dehydrated skin . Everyone‚Äôs skin is unique. This means that‚Äîdepending on factors like your age , environment, and health status‚Äîsigns of dry skin can vary from person to person. According to the Mayo Clinic , when skin loses too much moisture, you may experience a feeling of tightness, as well as rough texture, itchiness, flaking, and more visible fine lines. These signs of dry skin may worsen with age (especially over 40), as well as during the harsh, dry winter months 1 . That‚Äôs why it‚Äôs so important to listen to your skin and seek the help of a dermatologist when needed. To help tackle dry skin, you‚Äôll need a targeted skincare routine that helps preserve and enhance skin moisture levels. We recommend using a gentle, yet effective cleanser for dry skin twice daily to remove excess oil and dirt, without leaving your skin feeling stripped. Applying moisturizer regularly‚Äîespecially after bathing when your skin is still slightly damp‚Äîis another important step to help hydrate and soothe dry skin. It may also be helpful to carry travel-friendly skincare products for dry skin, like moisturizing hand cream or ointment, to help relieve dryness on-the-go. Proper sun protective measures should also be a core part of your daily dry skin regimen since damage from the sun‚Äôs harmful rays may worsen dryness 1 . For further guidance on how to help relieve dry skin, consult with your physician or dermatologist. Dry skin that is painful, cracks, bleeds, or interferes with your quality of life should always be assessed by a medical professional and may be a sign of an underlying illness 1 . When looking for the best products for dry skin, check the label for beneficial ingredients (like hyaluronic acid , glycerin, and niacinamide ) and seals of approval from reputable organizations (like the National Eczema Association). The American Academy of Dermatology AAD , for instance, recommends avoiding products that contain alcohol, fragrance, or harsh chemical exfoliants, as these may be irritating to dry skin or strip away natural oils. 2 This is one of many reasons all CeraVe products for dry skin are fragrance-free and developed with dermatologists . Formulated with three essential ceramides , they also help to lock in moisture and help maintain your skin‚Äôs protective barrier. Ceramides (pronounced ‚Äúsair-uh-mydes‚Äù) are essential natural fatty components of human and animal skin, making up around 50% of its outer layer. They‚Äôre essential in helping to replenish and maintain your natural protective skin barrier, which helps keep moisture in and harmful elements out. 3 When there‚Äôs a lack of humidity in the air, the levels of ceramides in your skin become depleted, leading to dry skin and other issues. Plus, as we age, our natural production of ceramides slows down. Both of these factors can contribute to dry skin either seasonally or year-round. 3 This is why ceramides are such an effective ingredient in skincare products for dry skin, as well as for healthy-looking skin in general. Body moisturizers, like body lotions and body creams, are a key part of any successful skincare routine . Using the right body moisturizer formulated for your skin type can help hydrate, seal in moisture, and leave your skin looking more supple, smoother, and healthier. When used consistently as part of a daily body care routine , body moisturizers can also help maintain your skin barrier and manage skin concerns such as dryness , rough skin texture, and itchy skin . CeraVe‚Äôs fragrance-free body moisturizers are developed with dermatologists to help soothe and support healthy-looking skin. Formulated with three essential ceramides , these body lotions, body creams, ointment, and oil help lock in moisture and maintain your skin‚Äôs protective barrier. You‚Äôll also find targeted treatments designed to smooth rough and bumpy skin and soothe itching and other symptoms from chronic conditions such as eczema and psoriasis . Find the Best Body Moisturizer for Your Skin Explore our range of body moisturizers to find the right option for your skin‚Äôs unique needs. Frequently Asked Questions According to the American Academy of Dermatology, all skin types‚Äîeven oily ones‚Äîcan benefit from supplemental hydration 1 . That‚Äôs where body moisturizer comes in: It helps hydrate and soothe skin, whether it‚Äôs on your hands, knees, feet , or elsewhere. Body moisturizer, such as body lotion and body cream, is usually applied as the final step in your daily body care routine to help keep your skin feeling smoother, softer, and more comfortable. CeraVe Daily Moisturizing Lotion , for example, can be used as often as needed to provide 48-hour hydration and help restore your skin‚Äôs protective barrier. This lightweight, oil-free body lotion is also formulated with three essential ceramides and MVE Delivery Technology, which encapsulates hydrating ingredients to ensure efficient delivery and slow release over time. Body lotions and body creams provide similar moisturizing benefits, however they‚Äôre formulated into different textures. Lotions, for example, tend to contain more water in their formulations than creams, giving them a more lightweight feeling, which may be more ideal for those with oily or normal skin. On the other hand, body creams (such as CeraVe Moisturizing Cream ) have a richer formulas with more emollient ingredients than body lotions. Their nourishing texture can be helpful for anyone with normal to dry skin or for seasonal dryness that can occur during winter months. Body creams can also be useful for mature skin, which tends to lose its ability to retain moisture with age. To learn more, read our skincare guide on the differences between lotion, cream, and ointment . Yes!
